field.p: ‚ö†Ô∏è Auto-Generated Records: This log auto-creates when barcodes are generated. You cannot manually add entries.

ul.li: Container Barcode Generation: When storage box gets new barcode assigned
Shredding Bin Barcode Generation: When bin receives unique identifier
Batch Generation: When generating 100+ barcodes via bulk wizard
Replacement Barcodes: When damaged/lost barcode is regenerated
Sequence Resets: When administrator resets barcode numbering
Generated Barcode: The actual barcode number/string created
Timestamp: Exact date/time of generation (down to the second)
Barcode Type: Storage box, shred bin, document label, asset tag
Sequence Number: Position in sequential numbering system
Related Record: Link to container/bin/asset that received barcode
Generation Method: Auto, manual, batch wizard, replacement
Duplicate Detection: Search for accidentally re-used barcode numbers
Audit Compliance: Prove to auditors when/how barcodes were assigned
User Accountability: Identify who generated problematic barcodes
Sequence Verification: Ensure no gaps in sequential numbering
Volume Analysis: Track how many barcodes generated per month/user
Troubleshooting: Diagnose barcode scanning issues by reviewing generation details

field.p:
üöÄ Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Immutable Records: Cannot be edited/deleted (tamper-proof audit trail)
‚Ä¢ Sequential Tracking: Every barcode logs its sequence position
‚Ä¢ User Attribution: Every generation tied to specific employee
‚Ä¢ Type Classification: Filter by storage box / shred bin / document label
‚Ä¢ Related Record Links: Click through to container/bin that owns barcode
‚Ä¢ Timestamp Precision: Sub-second accuracy for forensic analysis
‚Ä¢ Search by Barcode: Find generation details of any barcode instantly

üí° Pro Tips:
‚Ä¢ Filter by Today to review all barcodes generated in current shift
‚Ä¢ Search by Barcode Number to verify when/who generated specific code
‚Ä¢ Group by User to audit employee barcode generation activity
‚Ä¢ Export monthly for off-system backup (redundant audit protection)
‚Ä¢ Review sequence gaps to identify skipped numbers or sequence resets
